events.text: Listen, Rabbit. I can tolerate your stinginess during the travelin’ season, but the storm’s nearly here. Now you better pay up, or get out. I have one last trade I can make before the storm hits, and I intend to make it.
I don’t appreciate your attitude, Fox. I’m a working father with a whole host of kids to take care of. Cut me some damn slack.
I’ve been cutting you slack for years. This storms supposed to be a bad one!
Not sure we can say that definitively yet, Fox.
Oh come on. I need Rabbit’s tab paid if we’re going to be able to buy extra skins from that crazy trader.
We need the extra skins less than you need my produce, Fox.
Rabbit, you tool! Don’t tell me you can’t pay the tab!
This is not the time to be hard on your neighbors, Fox! You gotta help us out, Skunk.
Fox, cut him whatever slack you can. Rabbit, do us a favor and pay what you can, we will do our best to cover the rest
Rabbit, you have to pay up. We need to get as many skins as we can. I know it’s harsh, but you’ve gotten a lot of slack in the past.
Those defenses better be worth it, Skunk.
Fox is right, Rabbit. This storm is going to be a doozy. Best to be as prepared as we can.
Alright, if it’s really going to be that bad, I’ll scrounge up what I can.
Thanks, love. We should be able to get enough skins to keep the cold out.
